message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about the lunar cycle. A full moon occurs approximately once every 29.5 days. Therefore, if you miss seeing a full moon, you would have to wait approximately a month for another chance to see one. Option (A) is incorrect because 7 days is not long enough for a full lunar cycle. Option (C) is incorrect because a week is also not long enough for a full lunar cycle. Option (D) is incorrect because 168 hours is equivalent to 7 days, which as mentioned earlier, is not long enough for a full lunar cycle.
